properties.areaDesc: Central Lakes; Lake Sunapee and Monadnocks; Merrimack Valley; Seacoast
properties.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 27 at 2:50PM EDT until October 27 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Gray ME
properties.description:
...BREEZY AND DRY CONDITIONS WILL LEAD TO CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER
CONDITIONS SUNDAY...

..The combination of winds gusting up to 30 mph and dry air with
relative humidity values falling between 20 and 30 percent is
expected to create critical fire weather conditions this evening.
Dead and dry vegetation will combine with these weather
conditions, leading to the potential of rapid fire growth..

* Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 023 Central Lakes, Fire
Weather Zone 024 Lake Sunapee and Monadnocks, Fire Weather
Zone 025 Merrimack Valley and Fire Weather Zone 026 Seacoast.

* Timing...This evening

* Winds...West 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 30 mph.

* Relative Humidity...As low as 28 percent.

* Temperatures...Highs in the lower 50s.

* Lightning...None

* Impacts...Any fire that develops will catch and spread
quickly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
properties.instruction:
A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions
are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of
strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can
contribute to extreme fire behavior. Always consult with local
fire officials before engaging in any open burning activities and
comply with all applicable laws and regulations. Never leave an
open fire unattended and always extinguish campfires completely
before leaving.

NWSheadline: RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS

title: Current watches, warnings, and advisories for 43.24 N, 71.55 W
